item.title: Daily Podcast 2026-03-01
item.description: The United Nations has launched a new scientific advisory body on artificial intelligence, modeled explicitly after the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. | The panel consists of 40 members from 37 nations, appointed for three-year terms after a review of over 2,600 candidates by three UN technical agencies. | Unlike the IPCC, which focuses primarily on climate science, this panel has a broader mandate covering multiple dimensions of AI's impact.
item.itunes:author: Eva Dai
item.itunes:summary: The United Nations has launched a new scientific advisory body on artificial intelligence, modeled explicitly after the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change. | The panel consists of 40 members from 37 nations, appointed for three-year terms after a review of over 2,600 candidates by three UN technical agencies. | Unlike the IPCC, which focuses primarily on climate science, this panel has a broader mandate covering multiple dimensions of AI's impact.
